ExecutableTestSuite.label: Conformance class: Application schema, Atmospheric Conditions and Meteorological Geographical Features
ExecutableTestSuite.description:
This test suite examines requirements associated with the application schema.

Note that since both code-list-valued properties of this application schema may be extended without restrictions, there is no test case for code list values.

This is a draft version. It has limitations and is expected to contain errors. Please report any issues or problems in GitHub.

Known limitations are documented in the description of the applicable test case or test assertion. There is a general limitation in all assertions that extensions in additional application schemas are only supported, if the unqualified name of the feature type in the extension is the same as the name of the feature type in the INSPIRE application schema.

Source: Conformance Class 'Application schema, Atmospheric Conditions and Meteorological Geographical Features'

Pre-requisite conformance classes:
  • Conformance Class 'GML application schemas, Atmospheric Conditions and Meteorological Geographical Features'
ExecutableTestSuite.author: Consortium Bilbomatica, Guadaltel y Geograma

ParameterList.name: ETF Standard Parameters for XML test objects

TestCase.label: Specific requirements
TestCase.description: Verify that the features provided in the dataset adhere to the theme-specific requirements specified in the INSPIRE application schema.

TestAssertion.label: ac-mf-as.a.1: Allowed feature types
TestAssertion.description:
Check whether the data related to the theme Atmospheric Conditions and Meteorological Geographical Features are made available using the types defined in the Specialised Observations package in Annex I (IR-ISDSS), the OM_Observation spatial object type or sub-types thereof.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Annex IV, Section 13.3: The observed property of an OM_Observation shall be identified by an identifier from the EU Air Quality Reference Component, the WMO GRIB Code & Flags Table 4.2, the Climate and Forecast Standard Names vocabularies or another appropriate vocabulary
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Specific Requirements', INSPIRE Data Specification on Atmospheric Conditions and Meteorological Geographical Features, A.1.8
TestAssertion.expression:
let $features_selected := $features[not(self::omso:PointObservation | self::omso:PointTimeSeriesObservation | self::omso:MultiPointObservation | self::omso:GridObservation | self::omso:GridSeriesObservation | self::omso:PointObservationCollection | self::omso:ProfileObservation | self::omso:TrajectoryObservation | self::om:OM_Observation)] let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected
return if (count ($features_selected) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.constraintViolation', map { 'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType': local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@gml:id), 'constraint': 'The theme-specific requirements that are specified in the UML model of the application schema are met', 'additionalInfo':''})
else () return
(if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.label: ac-mf-as.a.2: gridded data
TestAssertion.description:
By way of derogation from the requirements of Section 2.2. of Annex II (IR-ISDSS), gridded data related to the theme Atmospheric Conditions and Meteorological Geographical Features may be made available using any appropriate grid.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Annex IV, Section 13.3: The observed property of an OM_Observation shall be identified by an identifier from the EU Air Quality Reference Component, the WMO GRIB Code & Flags Table 4.2, the Climate and Forecast Standard Names vocabularies or another appropriate vocabulary
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Specific Requirements', INSPIRE Data Specification on Atmospheric Conditions and Meteorological Geographical Features, A.1.8

TestAssertion.label: ac-mf-as.a.3: observed property
TestAssertion.description:
Check that the observed property of an OM_Observation is identified by an identifier from the EU Air Quality Reference Component, the WMO GRIB Code & Flags Table 4.2, the Climate and Forecast Standard Names vocabularies or another appropriate vocabulary.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Annex IV, Section 13.3: The observed property of an OM_Observation shall be identified by an identifier from the EU Air Quality Reference Component, the WMO GRIB Code & Flags Table 4.2, the Climate and Forecast Standard Names vocabularies or another appropriate vocabulary.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Specific Requirements', INSPIRE Data Specification on Atmospheric Conditions and Meteorological Geographical Features, A.1.8
